docs.snippet: Starting this month, people charged with the possession of a firearm in the city will be sent to State Supreme Court in Brooklyn, which will preside over gun arrest cases....
docs.lead_paragraph: Starting this month, people charged with the possession of a firearm in the city will be sent to State Supreme Court in Brooklyn, which will preside over gun arrest cases.
docs.abstract: New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio is set to announce new system for addressing gun violence cases, responding to persistent shootings throughout city; included in plan is  dedicated gun court in Brooklyn that will work in tandem with 200-officer Gun Violence Suppression Division, in charge of investigations into illegal firearms.

headline.main: De Blasio to Announce New System Dedicated to Addressing Gun Crime in New York City
headline.print_headline: De Blasio to Announce New System Dedicated to Addressing Gun Crime

headline.main: Germany to Ease Deportation Rules After Cologne Attacks

docs.snippet: The Texas Republican lacks the Christian virtues many evangelical voters may expect....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Texas Republican lacks the Christian virtues many evangelical voters may expect.
docs.abstract: David Brooks Op-Ed column suggests Sen Ted Cruz has come up short when it comes to Christian virtues, and has instead had a career marked by overzealous application of the law, in a way that violates spirit of the law; observes that Cruz's speeches are marred by ridiculous apocalyptic themes; posits that Cruz's brutal approach is antithesis of best influence evangelicals and other conservatives have had on American politics.

docs.snippet: Her first book, ‘On the Run' — about the lives of young black men in West Philadelphia — has fueled a fight within sociology over who gets to speak for whom....
docs.lead_paragraph: Her first book, ‘On the Run' — about the lives of young black men in West Philadelphia — has fueled a fight within sociology over who gets to speak for whom.
docs.abstract: On the Run, book written by white sociologist Alice Goffman, chronicling lives of young black men in mixed-income neighborhood in West Philadelphia, has sparked controversy over modern ethnography and who should be allowed to speak for whom.
